channel.title: Avoiding a ban
channel.description:
Ok so I was wondering roughly how long it would be before I would get banned/reset if I use rsclient to autoclick? I mean my friend just got 94 mage with it and i thought they could detect it easily but i've never heared of anyone being banned for using it?
If it helps i'm just using it to click on my inventory tab to keep my account from logging out.

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @DannyC DannyC
item.description:
@DannyC wrote:

I don’t support RS cheats, but auto clicking is easy to get banned if you do it long enough. Get a bot that’s anti-ban. Or for some experience program your own autoclicker.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Jagex can tell if you have a low grade auto clicker/bot because it will click the same exact pixel every time which is not humanly possible. Check to make sure your bot is advanced enough to have this feature and stay clear of my bot busting team.

Isn’t it possible though if you dont move the mouse?

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:14, topic:413469”]Jagex can tell if you have a low grade auto clicker/bot because it will click the same exact pixel every time which is not humanly possible. Check to make sure your bot is advanced enough to have this feature and stay clear of my bot busting team. ;)[/quote]dats what i saidddddddd

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Jagex can tell if you have a low grade auto clicker/bot because it will click the same exact pixel every time which is not humanly possible. Check to make sure your bot is advanced enough to have this feature and stay clear of my bot busting team.

With a laptop touchpad you can Just lock the actual touchpad, and use the buttons to click

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Doesn’t the camera move a couple of pixels every 30 seconds?

So if you’re using a cheap auto clicker it puts it off? I’ve auto clicked on MenaceScape when it was a BattleScape server and I’d spend 7 of the 8 hours clicking a wall.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Jagex can tell if you have a low grade auto clicker/bot because it will click the same exact pixel every time which is not humanly possible. Check to make sure your bot is advanced enough to have this feature and stay clear of my bot busting team.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Standing in the bank of Soul Wars while a J-mod comes to inspect for the day.

Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Just get a free auto alcher, go stand in a big stack at SW, you have better chances.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Like Chassy said, there’s tons of people that autoclick. Chances are that they’ll get you is around 10% out of all… Don’t worry.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I went from 88 or 89 magic to 94 in a few nights. Download an autoclicker that can click in a certain square or area of another shape. I left mine all night. I alched in a foreign world pest control boat and then switched to Soul Wars. I doubt you’ll get caught if you do it quickly. There are so many people doing the same exact thing at Soul Wars.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

No. When you use rsclient, I’m almost positive jagex times clicking intervals. And if you’re clicking every 1.2323464 seconds, then you’re going to fucked

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @_Coded ..::Coded::..
item.description:
@_Coded wrote:

I have seen videos where people set up “thignys” like drills and other things that auto clicked for them, since it actually clicked the mouse they could get banned

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:6, topic:413469”]You can still get banned without people reporting you.

/playing unusual hours and doing the same clicks all the time.[/quote]

Not true. I’ve botted 99 fletching, 99 cooking, 89 thieving and 89 hunter and nothing happened to me. You just have to bot smart. Or have a crappy computer like mine that shuts off the bot after like 4 hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

You can still get banned without people reporting you.

/playing unusual hours and doing the same clicks all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

There’s a way you can make your mouse move all around so you stay logged in on runescape, and I’m sure it’s not a ban. It’s not a macro or any software that needs to be downloaded.
When you take a mouse and place it on the keyboard between 2 different keys, it moves the mouse around in weird directions, but keeps you logged into runescape. You need a certain mouse though :L I can find you the video on youtube if you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Avoiding a ban
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:

awsome ty guys

Read full topic

If it helps i’m just using it to click on my inventory tab to keep my account from logging out.[/quote]
Just do it for like 8 hours then stop it.
